tool.name: GenerateOverlay
tool.toolboxalias: Generates Overlay Table as a flat file.

param.name: indexTbl
param.displayname: Index Table (Input FC and Field List)
param.dialogReference:
CSV Index Table containing the columns:

  • FC_OV_ORDER (ShortInteger) - populated with the order in which the feature classes are to be overlaid, which determines the order of the fields in the final table

  • IN_FC (String) - the ALRS feature class name where input fields are located

  • IN_FLD (String) - the field names that are going to get pulled from the ALRS features classes

  • OUT_FLD_NAME (String) - output field names; provides an opportunity to rename the fields in the output instead of matching names from the input

param.name: RH_SDE
param.dialogReference: The Database containing the source feature classes and fields needed to create the Overlay Output. This can be an SDE Database or a File Geodatabase.

param.name: routes
param.dialogReference: The route feature class from the ALRS database. The Route ID, From Date and To Date of all input events should match with the corresponding field names in the routes feature class chosen in this parameter.

param.name: FromDate
param.dialogReference: The From Date field from the routes feature class. This field name must be consistent across all event layers listed in the CSV Index Table.

param.name: ToDate
param.dialogReference: The To Date field from the routes feature class. This field name must be consistent across all event layers listed in the CSV Index Table.

param.name: translateDate
param.dialogReference: If you need to report data from a specific point in time, use the Date picker to choose that date. If you need to report the most current data then this value can be left as is.

param.name: RouteID
param.dialogReference: The Route ID from the routes feature class. This field name must be consistent across all event layers listed in the CSV Index Table.

param.name: FromMM
param.dialogReference: The From Measure field name present in the event data layers in the ALRS. This field name must be consistent across all event layers listed in the CSV Index Table.

param.name: ToMM
param.dialogReference: The To Measure field name present in the event data layers in the ALRS. This field name must be consistent across all event layers listed in the CSV Index Table.

param.name: decPlaces
param.displayname: Decimal Places of Final Output From/To Measures
param.dialogReference: Integer value for the number of decimal places the Measure fields of the final output table will be rounded to (e.g. 2; From Measure will be rounded from 32.24312 to 32.24. Note: this rounding operation is a Python function which may truncate numbers, rather than round them. For example, 32.245 may become 32.24 not 32.25).

param.name: SQL_Query
param.displayname: SQL Expression for events in Index Table
param.dialogReference: An optional query used when copying tables from the Roads and Highways Database to the Staging Database. Any fields referenced in the query must be located in every input event listed in the CSV Index Table. This query is useful if you want to report data on a limited selection of routes, for example.

param.name: outFldr
param.dialogReference: Folder where the output File Geodatabase will be created. You must have read/write permissions for the directory.

tool.summary: This tool performs table-based overlays between multiple events in an ALRS, producing a snapshot of dynamically-segmented data. The output table and feature class are provided in a File Geodatabase created by the tool.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool performs table-based overlays between multiple events in an ALRS, producing a snapshot of dynamically-segmented data. The output table and feature class are provided in a File Geodatabase created by the tool.
